basics.name: Kyle O'Connor
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior level Software Engineer with strong technical and leadership skills as well as 12 years of experience across the R&D, defense and biometrics industries.

work.summary: Princeton Identity is a biometric identity management company used in various markets such as government, physical access control, commercial real estate. Created as a spin-off from SRI International with investment from Samsung.
highlights: Lead the software team and all software development efforts, including software/hardware integration
Architected multi-tenant cloud application using AWS (and other services), focused on security and best practices
Design and develop frontend and backend web applications for multimodal biometrics products (Spring Boot, React, PostgreSQL)
Experience with embedded software and BSP development (Linux kernel drivers, PIC firmware)
Implement and maintain DevOps infrastructure on-prem and in the cloud, including automated deployment and monitoring
Familiar with mobile development on Android and iOS
Excellent configuration management practices - branching, merging, release candidates, etc.

work.summary: Member of System Software Design and Development group
highlights: Maintained common software framework across all products

Designed and developed software for multiple products in the biometrics and geospatial domains such as multimodal biometrics on mobile (Android) and embedded platforms, real-time video processing and georegistration systems
Algorithm implementation from MATLAB, focused on accuracy/performance/optimization (SIMD)
Supported the infrastructure for continuous integration, static analysis, and unit testing

work.summary: Member of User-Centered Interfaces group focusing on Human Computer Interaction
highlights: Lead the integration of two major internal software products
Interfaced with spoken language understanding technology
Handled multiple development tasks in Java and coordinated with a team of developers
Implemented software utilities to automate manual testing tasks
Designed dynamic and interactive interfaces for augmented reality efforts

work.summary: Member of Engineering Test & Evaluation team for Ballistic Missile Defense signal processor
highlights: Performed radar and signal processing tests at navy test facility
Wrote documentation for test requirements and procedures
Obtained full secret security clearance and dealt with classified information
Supported packaging and distribution of software/updates to company
Aided department with general IT and Windows support
Instrumental in training new employee on packaging processes

publications.name: "Method and System for Seamless Biometric System Self-Enrollment"

projects.name: Open Source Contributions
highlights: libpopcnt (Fast C/C++ bit population count library)
localstack (Local AWS cloud stack)
jansson (C library for handling JSON data)
terraform-provider-postmark

projects.name: Senior Design Project
projects.summary: Air Quality Sensor Network for Philadelphia
projects.description: Collaborated with the Philadelphia Clean Air Council to design and deploy a portable air quality sensor network (ZigBee). Recognized as 2nd best project in the ECE Department.
